meanings.definition: A duplicating machine using a gelatin pad
meanings.sent1: The teacher made copies using a hectograph in the school office.
meanings.sent2: The hectograph was used to duplicate important documents quickly.
meanings.sent3: The hectograph at the office was always busy, churning out copies.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a hectograph, duplicating memories with perfect clarity.
meanings.sent5: The gelatin pad on the hectograph absorbed the ink, ready to duplicate the page.

meanings.definition: To reproduce by using a hectograph
meanings.sent1: She hectographed the report for distribution to the team.
meanings.sent2: They hectograph their newsletters to share with the community.
meanings.sent3: He hectographs his notes to make sure he doesn't forget anything important.
meanings.sent4: The idea hectographed itself in her mind, spreading to others effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The artist hectographs her sketches to create multiple copies for sale.
